Using the TPTP 3.3 20050509_0816 build, remote log import with filters fails on 
Linux/ia32, HP, Solaris and AIX.  The following error message is issued from 
the Log Import wizard:

IWAT0030E An error occurred during the execution of the remote log 
parser "org.eclipse.hyades.logging.adapter.config.StaticParserWrapper": 
IWAT0369E The adapter configuration file GLA42171.adapter cannot be found.

With TPTP 3.3 20050501_1719 build, remote log import with filters works fine 
with no errors.

This problem could be related to the change made recently to the RAC File 
Server support (see bugzilla 75002) since it appears the adapter file was not 
transferred to the remote system.

Reducing the severity of this problem because with current drivers 
(20050510_0200) the problem is intermittent.

Hi Dave,

Can you please add the steps necessary to reproduce this problem?  We are 
maknig good progress on the other issues and hope to get to this problem soon.

Thanks,
--Joe

Joe, I am transferring this to you because it looks like a file transfer 
problem.

We have traced this problem to a file transfer failure not being returned.  The 
call to fileManager.putFile(sourceFile, targetFile); sometimes does not throw 
an exception when it fails.  In the remote import with filter scenario, the 
client workbench tries to send the GLA adapter file containing the filter blade 
to the remote system.  However, it does not know what OS is running on the 
remote system so first tries to transfer the file to c:\ on the remote 
machine.  If that fails, it assumes the machine is non-Windows and tries to 
transfer the file to /tmp.  If putFile does not throw an exception when trying 
to transfer the file to c:\ on a non-Windows machine, it assumes the transfer 
was successful and continues with the import operation which obviously fails 
because the adapter file is not there.  This is the problem we are encountering.

The putFile call is made in 
org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui.internal.util.GLAFilterHelper.sendAdapter method.

To reproduce this problem:

1) Start the RAC on a remote system.
2) Start eclipse with TPTP on your workstation.
3) In Eclise, select File->Import...->Log file and click Next.
4) Click on Add... button in Log Files window to add a log file to import.
5) Select the log file type from the list at the top of the window.  Then Add 
the host name of the remote system to the Host list and select it in the Host 
name tab.
6) Select the Details tab and fill in the fields for the specific log file.
7) Select the Filter tab and and click New... to add a filter
8) Click OK to select the default when asked to select the type of filter.
9) Check the Filter by Events box on the Standard tab in the Edit Filter 
window.  Leave the remaining fields with the default values. Click OK.
10) Click OK and then Finish to start the import.
11) If the import fails you will see an error dialog with a message saying the 
adapter file cannot be found.

As I indicated before, this is an intermittent problem.  Sometimes the import 
succeeds.  Also, sometimes when running in a runtime workbench the import 
succeeds but an error is still displayed.  The following exception is displayed 
in the development workbench console:

java.net.SocketException: Socket is closed
	at java.net.Socket.getOutputStream(Socket.java:761)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ConnectionImpl.sendMessage
(ConnectionImpl.java:290)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerExtendedImpl.queryFileServerL
ocation(FileManagerExtendedImpl.java:421)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerExtendedImpl.<init>
(FileManagerExtendedImpl.java:79)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerFactory.create
(FileManagerFactory.java:75)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui.internal.util.GLAFilterHelper.deleteTempAdapter
(GLAFilterHelper.java:478)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.log.ui.internal.wizards.ImportLogWizard$RemoteLogImportJob.ru
n(ImportLogWizard.java:1263)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

This exception occurs when the temporary adapter file is being deleted from the 
remote system after the import has completed.
